column4: anyone know why i may be getting a black screen with a blinking curser when booting from cd?
your CD burn was bad
ill try and burn another one then, brb
WAIT!
yea?
can you get to the menu screen and select "Check Disk for Errors"?
i boot up then it says compaq then there is a black screen with the blinking curser
sound like the CD isn't bootable (bad burn) or your BIOS isn't set up to boot from the CD drive
i just through it in to my macbook and it says it a blank
UGH!  Coaster for coffee :(
i think these may be bad cds, should i maybe try a dvd?
can you try a burn at the slowest speed possible, maybe even 1x if possible?
that will take forever lol but yea ill try it, i burnt the last 1 in ubuntu desktop
double check your downloaded ISO, check the MD5 Sum and ensure it isn't a bad download as well.  I love my USB Stick because of this :)
do you know of any way to force a usb boot if its not suported, also i downloaded these via torrent so i think they should be good
yes, there is a way with a floppy or CD boot.  I don't have the info in front of me, a quick Google should find a nice tutorial on it.
im going to try a dvd quick, if anything ill get a more expensive coaster out of this
that's a coaster for the scotch :)
technology just doesn't want to cooperate tonight, it may be a bit before i finally get this going
technology is supposed to make life easier... I'm on the fence, still :)
ok things are looking a bit better, its about to verify the disk
Good luck!  Hope this disk does well.
alright, now lets try this 1
how long would u say it should take for the blinking curser to go away?
